thread.title: NYC art exhibition gives food for thought
thread.title_full: NYC art exhibition gives food for thought - WCAX.COM Local Vermont News, Weather and Sports-

author: wcax.com
title: NYC art exhibition gives food for thought
text:
By ULA ILNYTZKY
Associated Press NEW YORK (AP) - There's a whole lot of food for thought at a new art exhibition in New York City.
"The Value of Food: Sustaining a Green Planet" explores food accessibility, sustainability and other food-related issues. The multimedia exhibition opened last week at the Cathedral of Saint John the Divine. It will run through April 3.
It features 30 artists whose works are installed in the cathedral's seven chapels and 14 bays. The exhibit is divided into seven themes: water, soil, seed, farm, market, meal and waste.
Guest co-curator Robin Kahn says the cathedral's architecture takes visitors in a circle, almost like the food cycle.
Kahn says she hopes the exhibition will empower visitors to "look at food in a new way that's more beneficial not only to them but to the Earth."
